marketplaces.repo_description: This repository is a multi-skill workspace for agent automation utilities.

files.README.md:
# Agent Skills Hub

This repository is a multi-skill workspace for agent automation utilities.

## Repository layout

- `skills/` - each skill is an independent package
- `skills/<skill-name>/src` - TypeScript source for the skill runtime
- `skills/<skill-name>/SKILL.md` - skill trigger and behavior contract
- `skills/<skill-name>/README.md` - setup and usage docs
- `skills/<skill-name>/scripts/*` - tool scripts

## Current skills

- `object-storage-markdown-upload`
  - path: `skills/object-storage-markdown-upload`
  - purpose: upload local files to S3-compatible storage and output Markdown links
  - skill contract: `skills/object-storage-markdown-upload/SKILL.md`

## Must read before using any skill

Every skill has its own operational requirements.

You MUST read that skill's `README.md` before use, especially for:

- required environment variables
- provider-specific limitations (for example S3 vs R2 behavior)
- user-required inputs (for example local file path, public access policy)
- optional flags that change behavior (for example `--public-read`)

If you skip per-skill README instructions, auto-trigger reliability and runtime success will drop significantly.

For this repository, start here:

- `skills/object-storage-markdown-upload/README.md`

## Install into Claude Code

This repository is now marketplace-ready for Claude Code plugins.

Prerequisite:

- Claude Code `>= 1.0.33`

Add marketplace and install plugin:

```text
/plugin marketplace add taotao7/agent-skills-hub
/plugin install object-storage-markdown-upload@taotao7-agent-skills
```

CLI equivalent:

```bash
claude plugin marketplace add taotao7/agent-skills-hub
claude plugin install object-storage-markdown-upload@taotao7-agent-skills
```

Optional scope selection:

```bash
claude plugin install object-storage-markdown-upload@taotao7-agent-skills --scope project
```

## Team setup (auto prompt)

This repo includes `.claude/settings.json` with:

- `extraKnownMarketplaces` for `taotao7/agent-skills-hub`
- `enabledPlugins` enabling `object-storage-markdown-upload@taotao7-agent-skills`

When teammates open and trust this repository in Claude Code, they will be prompted to install/enable this marketplace plugin configuration.

## Workspace commands

Install dependencies:

```bash
bun install
```

Build all skills:

```bash
bun run build
```

Type-check all skills:

```bash
bun run check
```

## Add a new skill

1. Create directory under `skills/<new-skill-name>`
2. Add `package.json`, `tsconfig.json`, `src/`, `README.md`, `SKILL.md`, `scripts`
3. Ensure build outputs runnable Claude/plugin entrypoint in `scripts/<entrypoint-scripts>`
4. Keep credential requirements explicit in docs when external services are used
files.skills/object-storage-markdown-upload/RE:
# Object Storage Markdown Upload Skill

Upload local files to S3-compatible object storage and instantly get Markdown links.

Best use case:
- writing Markdown docs and quickly embedding uploaded images/files

Supports:
- AWS S3
- Cloudflare R2
- Any S3-compatible object storage

## Install in Claude Code

Install from this repository marketplace:

```text
/plugin marketplace add taotao7/agent-skills-hub
/plugin install object-storage-markdown-upload@taotao7-agent-skills
```

CLI equivalent:

```bash
claude plugin marketplace add taotao7/agent-skills-hub
claude plugin install object-storage-markdown-upload@taotao7-agent-skills
```

This plugin is sourced from:
- `skills/object-storage-markdown-upload`

After installation, ask Claude with upload-oriented prompts, for example:
   - "Upload this image to R2 and return Markdown"
   - "Upload this file to S3 and give me a link"

Skill definition path:
- `skills/object-storage-markdown-upload/SKILL.md`

## Why auto-trigger can feel hard

Automatic skill invocation is context-based and not guaranteed every turn.

Common causes when it does not trigger:
- prompt does not clearly indicate upload intent
- local file path is missing
- required storage env vars are missing
- user did not specify whether result must be publicly readable

Reliable ways to trigger:
- state upload intent explicitly (S3/R2 + markdown output)
- include file path in the request
- mention public-read requirement when needed

## Requirements

You must set your own credentials and endpoint.
If env vars are missing, the uploader exits with error.

If the task needs a public URL, user participation is required to configure storage public access policy.

The CLI auto-loads `.env` from current working directory using `dotenv`.

## Setup

Install workspace dependencies from repo root:

```bash
bun install
```

Build this skill from repo root:

```bash
bun run --filter @agent-skills/object-storage-markdown-upload build
```

Output:
- `skills/object-storage-markdown-upload/scripts/cli.js`

## Environment variables

Required:

```bash
STORAGE_ACCESS_KEY_ID=<your-access-key-id>
STORAGE_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=<your-secret-access-key>
STORAGE_BUCKET=<your-bucket>
STORAGE_ENDPOINT=https://<endpoint>
```

Optional:

```bash
STORAGE_REGION=auto
STORAGE_PUBLIC_BASE_URL=https://<public-domain-or-cdn>
STORAGE_FORCE_PATH_STYLE=true
STORAGE_PUBLIC_READ=false
R2_ACCOUNT_ID=<cloudflare-account-id>
```

Supported aliases:
- AWS: `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`, `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY`, `AWS_REGION`, `AWS_S3_BUCKET`, `AWS_S3_ENDPOINT`
- R2: `R2_ACCESS_KEY_ID`, `R2_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY`, `R2_BUCKET`, `R2_ENDPOINT`

If `--provider r2` is passed and endpoint is not set, endpoint fallback is:
- `https://<R2_ACCOUNT_ID>.r2.cloudflarestorage.com`

## Run

From repo root:

```bash
./skills/object-storage-markdown-upload/scripts/cli.js ./assets/screenshot.png --alt "Dashboard" --markdown-only
```

Or from skill directory:

```bash
cd skills/object-storage-markdown-upload
./scripts/cli.js ./assets/screenshot.png --alt "Dashboard" --markdown-only
```

## CLI options

- `--alt <text>` markdown alt text for images
- `--prefix <path>` object key prefix (default `uploads`)
- `--key <object-key>` explicit object key
- `--provider <s3|r2|other>` provider hint for endpoint behavior
- `--markdown-only` print only markdown output
- `--public-read` request `public-read` ACL for S3 uploads

## Output behavior

- image file -> `![alt](url)`
- non-image file -> `[filename](url)`

## Public-read behavior

- S3: `--public-read` or `STORAGE_PUBLIC_READ=true` requests object ACL `public-read`
- R2: ACL flag is not applied; configure bucket/public domain and set `STORAGE_PUBLIC_BASE_URL`

## Security

- Never commit real AK/SK or `.env`
- Use least-privilege credentials
- Prefer `STORAGE_PUBLIC_BASE_URL` for stable public links
